task.title: Setting up on Windows
task.shortdesc: Before installing the add-on in , you must download, install, and perform a basic configuration of . If is already installed on your computer, you can skip this task.

step.stepresult: The download of the installer file starts automatically. Depending on your browser's settings, you may need to confirm the download.

step.cmd: From your Downloads folder, launch the installation wizard and complete the process by following the instructions on the screen.
When the installation is completed, on the Completing the Git Setup Wizard page, select the Launch Git Bash check box, and click Next.
In the Git Bash terminal window, configure your user name and email address, substituting the variables with your credentials:

info.pre: git config --global --user.name="First Name Last Name" git config --global --user.email="email@example.com"

step.cmd: Verify that your name and email were set correctly by listing the user configuration settings:
step.stepxmp: Example output:$ git config --list | grep "user" user.name=John Doe user.email=john.doe@email.com

taskbody.result: You now have a basic configuration and can install
